channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Says Only ‘Lord Almighty’ Could Make Him Quit Race
item.description: President Biden dismissed concerns about his age, his mental acuity and polls showing him losing his re-election bid.

item.title: Starmer Becomes U.K. Prime Minister After Labour Party Landslide
item.description: Labour’s resounding election victory ended 14 years of Conservative government. But a fragmented vote and low turnout pointed to a deeply unhappy Britain.

item.title: Biden says he ‘might’ exit race if God tells him to, while more Democrats urge him to drop out
item.description: “If the Lord Almighty comes down and tells me that, I might do that.”

item.title: Abductions Rattle Kenya as Anti-Government Protests Continue
item.description: Dozens of activists say they were snatched from their homes or off the streets by hooded, armed men. Some are still missing, and the disappearances have unnerved a nation long seen as a pillar of stability.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl Bears Down on the Yucatán Peninsula
item.description: The storm, now a Category 2, has lost some power since slamming Jamaica and Grenada this week. A hurricane warning is in effect for the coast of the Yucatán Peninsula.

item.title: There’s a ‘huge bottleneck’ in Nvidia AI chips, but that doesn’t mean regulatory action, EU competition chief says
item.description: “We’ve been asking them questions, but that is really preliminary,” she told Bloomberg during a trip to Singapore.

item.title: Can Foreigners Handle the Heat? Mexico City Debates Milder Salsas.
item.description: As more foreigners, especially Americans, visit or move to Mexico City, some taco shops have lowered the heat in their sauces. Not everyone is happy.

item.title: Abductions Rattle Kenya as Anti-Government Protests Continue
item.description: Dozens of activists say they were snatched from their homes or off the streets by hooded, armed men. Some are still missing, and the disappearances have unnerved a nation long seen as a pillar of stability.

item.title: Complaints about air travel have soared to nearly 100,000—even as flight cancellations decline
item.description: The Transportation Department said Friday that it received nearly 97,000 complaints in 2023, up from about 86,000 the year before.

item.title: Rachel Reeves, Britain’s First Female Chancellor, Turns to Janet Yellen for Inspiration
item.description: Rachel Reeves, who will oversee Britain’s budget, is expected to pursue an agenda influenced by Janet Yellen’s more activist approach to job-creation and investment in the United States.

item.title: Violence, Rape, Thirst, Even Organ Theft: Migrants Face Lethal Risks in Africa
item.description: The danger to migrants while crossing the Mediterranean is well documented, but an earlier phase of their trek, across the Sahel and the Sahara, is deadlier, researchers say in a new report.

item.title: Fed says central bank independence is good for the economy as Trump has vowed not to re-up Powell
item.description: “There is broad support for the principles underlying independent monetary policy,” the Fed said.

item.title: In Ukraine, Killings of Unarmed Russians Divide a U.S.-Led Unit
item.description: A German medic said he was so troubled that he confronted his commander. Others boasted about killings in a group chat.

item.title: Can Foreigners Handle the Heat? Mexico City Debates Milder Salsas.
item.description: As more foreigners, especially Americans, visit or move to Mexico City, some taco shops have lowered the heat in their sauces. Not everyone is happy.

item.title: Delta’s ‘spoiled’ food snafu during record air travel meant scores of flights shifted to pasta-only meals
item.description: “We did adjust meal service on a few dozen flights as we worked with catering on reviewing quality assurance of meals. Today, we are ramping up to our normal everyday service."
